author: newsdesk@westgaz.co.uk (Ben Hurst)
title: Bristol Airport cancels all Jet2 flights to Greek island
text:
Jet2 has issued a warning to passengers not to head to the airport as flights to a Greek island have been cancelled due to adverse weather conditions. The airline announced that all flights scheduled for today, Friday May 10, to Skiathos, a popular destination served from
Bristol, Birmingham, East Midlands, Leeds Bradford, London Stansted, Newcastle and Manchester airports, are cancelled and will be rescheduled.
In a statement,Jet2 said: "If you are travelling to Skiathos today, please do not travel to the airport. If you have already travelled to the airport, if possible, we would advise you to return home and come back to the airport 3 hours before your new departure time tomorrow.
"If it is not possible to make your way home, please speak to a member of our friendly Red team at the airport who will be happy to help."
Read More -
Bristol Airport short-stay car park has been ripped up
Read More -
Bristol Airport new destinations as Jet2 launches more flights
The airline further advised those unable to return home to seek assistance from their Red team at the airport. Jet2 also confirmed it is reaching out to passengers on Skiathos who were due to fly back today.
The airline added: "We apologise for this change that is unfortunately beyond our control, if you are due to travel to Skiathos today, we have sent all details of the change and your options to your email address on the booking."
"It is rare for our schedules to be disrupted like this and although this change is beyond our control, we understand it will disrupt your plans at last minute and have done everything that we can to ensure we operate as soon as possible and minimise the delay."
"We have a huge team working hard behind the scenes at our UK-based HQ that are monitoring the situation and on behalf of us all, we are sorry again for the inconvenience this delay brings."

author: @nbc6
title: 4 men charged in connection with 2021 mass shooting at El Mula banquet hall in Miami-Dade
text:
Miami-Dade Police conducted an overnight raid Thursday, taking three men into custody while a fourth was charged for their role in the deadly mass shooting outside the El Mula banquet hall in May of 2021.
“So today we’re announcing the arrests of four individuals for these murders and shootings,” Miami-Dade State Attorney Katherine Fernandez Rundle said at a news conference Thursday afternoon.
The suspects were identified as Allen Gregory Chambers, Jr., Willie Zavon Hill, Eugene Anthony Holmes and Jacarree Brian Green. Hill is already in federal custody serving time for possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Prosecutors charged all four men with three counts of first-degree murder, 20 counts of attempted first-degree murder with a deadly weapon and one count of conspiracy to commit first-degree murder. Hill is facing an additional charge for allegedly attempting to dispose of the white Nissan Pathfinder used in the crime.
Fernandez Rundle said the men went to El Mula that night to target members of a rival gang as the banquet hall hosted an album release party on May 30, 2021.
Video shows masked gunmen run from a stolen white Nissan Pathfinder, opening fire and killing 32-year-old Shanique Peterson, 26-year-old Desmond Owens and 26-year-old Clayton Dillard III.
“This attack was a planned assault. The targets included those who alleged attackers identified as rival gang members,” Fernandez Rundle said.
According to an arrest warrant, cell phone and GPS records established Holmes as the driver of the Pathfinder, and Green as the driver of a black Cadillac, and revealed Hill and Chambers as gunmen who exited that car.
“In total, the police recovered 99 spent shell casings,” Fernandez Rundle said, “Forensic analysis revealed that the casings were shot from nine different firearms.”
Investigators also said video from Holmes’ cell phone taken just hours after the shooting shows him and another subject bragging about the crime.
The violence prompted the county to launch what they called “Operation Summer Heat,” a partnership with local, state and federal law enforcement. Miami-Dade Mayor Daniella Levine Cava said it was so effective, it became permanent.
“It led to a longer-term effort called ‘Operation Community Shield,'” Levine Cava said. “Working together, we took over 3,000 illegal guns off the street.”
These are not the first arrests in this case. In November, Davonte Barnes was sentenced to life in prison for his role as a lookout in the shooting.
In 2021, police also arrested Warneric Buckner for his suspected role in the shooting—Buckner was identified as one of the men in the Pathfinder, but prosecutors had to drop charges after they said detectives improperly got a confession after he asked for attorney.
Buckner was also charged in connection with the murder of 6 year-old Chassidy Saunders in 2021. He pleaded not guilty in that case, which is ongoing.
“We, as a law enforcement community, vow that this investigation will continue until everyone who can be charged is charged,” said Fernandez Rundle.
Prosecutors said this investigation remains open and ongoing.

author: Lukman Mumuni
title: Madagascar Send Ghana Warning With Big Win to Go Top of World Cup Qualifiers Group
text:
Madagascar Send Ghana Warning With Big Win to Go Top of World Cup Qualifiers Group
- Madagascar have climbed to the top of Group I of the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers on Wednesday
- The Bareas defeated the Central African Republic in their matchday 5 encounter at Larbi Zaouli in Morocco
- The will next face Ghana, who will engage Chad on Friday at the Accra Sports Stadium before their trip to Morocco
Don't miss out! Get your daily dose of sports news straight to your phone. Join YEN's Sports News channel on WhatsApp now!
Ghana's Group I opponents in the World Cup qualifiers, Madagascar, recorded a resounding win to go top of the group ahead of the game against the Black Stars of Ghana.
The Bareas came from a goal down to hammer the Central African Republic 4-1 at the Larbi Zaouli Stadium in Casablanca.
The hosts raced to an early lead after Hugo Gambor broke the Madagascar offside line to fore home from a Gabriel Oualengbe free-kick.
Eight minutes later, Madagascar responded through Rayan Raveloson who finished off a fine move from the visitors. The attacker gave Madagascar the lead four minutes later after an error by Central African Republic goalkeeper Dominique Youfeigane to complete his brace.
After the break, the visitors extended their lead through Arnaud Randrianantenaina before Lalaina sealed victory in the 89th minute.
The victory sees Madagascar climbed to the top of the climb ahead of Ghana and Comoros, who are yet to honour their matchday five games.
Meanwhile, the win means Madagascar head into their match against Ghana in high spirits as their chances of qualifying for the World Cup stays alive.
The West African powerhouse, who failed to qualify for the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco, will face Chad on Friday before their trip to Morocco.
Desmond Offei shares approach for qualifiers
New assistant coach of the Black Stars, Desmond Offei, has disclosed that the Black Stars will head into the two games as if they were final matches.
Ghana are on a revival mission after failing to qualify for the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.
He said, as quoted by Ghana FA's website:
"First of all, I think we have to look at ourselves because we have enough quality in the squad to make sure that we perform on the day.
"Yes, of course we want to also make the Ghanaian fans very proud of us, so it's very important that we give a really good performance against Chad at home. They're going to fight and it's going to be like a final.
"So for us, I think it's very important to make sure that this window is wrapped up very, very positively and make sure that the Ghanaian fans are very well and very happy with us. Like I said, we have to look at their strengths.
"Now both teams, Chad and Madagascar, have new coaches, so we don’t know how they're going to set up. But we know the players of course, so it's about us and how we get the boys ready to fight and make sure they give everything on a day."
Mahama visits Black Stars
Earlier, YEN.com.gh reported that President John Dramani Mahama paid a courtesy visit to the senior national team the Black Stars ahead of the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
The President, joined by the Minister of Sports and Recreation, as well as the head of Ghana's football Kurt Okraku, met the team after training on Wednesday.
President Mahama was introduced to the team before he delivered a morale-boosting message to the players as they prepared for Chad on Friday.
New feature: Сheck out news that is picked for YOU ➡️ click on “Recommended for you” and enjoy!
Source: YEN.com.gh
Lukman Mumuni (Sports Editor) Lukman Abdul Mumin is a CAF-accredited Sports Journalist based in Accra, Ghana. He has been writing for the past eight years. Lukman has worked with some of Ghana's big media houses like GMA and was a regular pundit on GTV. He started his journalism career as a presenter and a writer after studying at the Gee Way Media School. Lukman has covered several international competitions including AFCON 2023. Email: lukmanevergreen2g15@gmail.com

author: Supercinexin
title: #33 Borrell considera un "castigo colectivo" a los palestinos el bloqueo a la entrega de fondos a la UNRWA
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#2](c2#c-2) Borrell es el alto representante de la UE, lo que dice no se debe considerar su opinión sino la postura oficial de la UE, que por supuesto puede ser distinta a la de cada país en concreto.
[#8](c8#c-8) eso iba a decir yo. Que si se saliera mucho del guión le quitarían ipso facto. Encima de que es español y de vez en cuando cosas como ésta nos lo echamos al cuello. Habría que ver si su puesto estuviera ocupado por González Pons o por un tipo Orban.
[#2](c2#c-2) Habrá un día en que Borrell condene con acciones esta masacre y denuncie ante los tribunales internacionales, en representación de la UE, los actos genocidas del gobierno de Israel sobre Gaza.
Entonces ahí sí creeré estas historias para no dormir que cuenta.
Pero seguramente eso nunca ocurrirá porque bien sabe que la UE es cómplice de tal genocidio, y que si se pronunciara de esa manera, su jefa le daría la patada, quedándose el pobre Borrelito sin su puesto tan chulo, molón y prominente.
No disfruta ni nada con el protagonismo que tiene.
[#2](c2#c-2) pero sin tirar cohetes, que parte de dar credibilidad a un estado que funciona como un puto mafioso: extorsión, amenazas, asesinatos y difamación.
[#2](c2#c-2) No tiene miedo que le pase lo que le pasó a Gaspar Llamazares con el FBI, otros comunistas como Yoli si que tienen miedo (o egoísmo) de ahí su apoyo a la OTAN.
[#5](c5#c-5) El próximo vas a flipar. Sanciones europeas a todo aquel que insulte al Isra, ques mu güen chaval.
[#27](c27#c-27) Le quedan unos meses, no hace falta cancelarlo y quedar mal, como si fuéramos unos Vladimires cualquiera. Aquí somos muy democráticos. Se le dice en privado que deje de tocar las pelotas y será mejor para todos y en cuatro mesecillos de nada se pone a otro en el mismo puesto que meta línea dura de apoyo incondicional a Israel con más armamento y más dineros y que condene muy fuerte a Hamás y ya está, arreglao.
Borrell eclipsando el escándalo de 50.000 millones para ucrania:
Orbán se rinde y permite a la UE aprobar 50.000 millones de euros en ayudas para Ucrania
Resumen de este envío: Borrell demostrando mayor consistencia moral los zazis de MNM. Lo que tampoco es tan difícil.
Por supuesto, nunca lo admitirán. Ni ante sí mismos.
[#11](c11#c-11) Y tu te estas aprovechando de su postura razonable y sensata, apoyando al pueblo indefenso, para atacarlos gratuitamente.
[#13](c13#c-13) No necesito que Felipe y Josep hagan este tipo de declaraciones para señalar su cara dura y su hipocresía. Ambos personajes tienen una amplia trayectoria de felonías contrastadas. Me limito a expresar que su supuesto apoyo a la población palestina en este contexto es completamente falsa y que el interés que tienen en hacer estas declaraciones es pura y simplemente lavar un poco su maltrecha imagen.
[#16](c16#c-16) y si dices que sin tan malos pa que iban a querer ponerse en contra a países poderosos? Si tan malos son pasarían de la gente y preferirían congraciarse con los poderosos

author: Muhammad Jawad
title: Thousands rally across Pakistan to demand humanitarian corridor for Gaza
text:
Thousands across Pakistan took to the streets on Sunday to show solidarity with the Palestinians and call for an immediate halt to the ongoing violence in Gaza. In a series of coordinated protests led by Jamaat-e-Islami (JI), a key religiopolitical group, citizens from Islamabad, Karachi, and other major cities demanded the international community intervene to stop what they termed the ' genocide ' in Gaza. With over 31,000 Palestinians, mainly women and children, reported dead since October 7, the rallies underscored the escalating humanitarian crisis and the urgent need for international action.
Advertisment Mass Mobilization Against Israeli Actions In the capital city of Islamabad, a significant crowd, including families, gathered at the iconic D chowk before marching toward Serena Chowk, brandishing banners and Palestinian flags while chanting anti-Israel and pro-Palestine slogans. JI chief Siraj-ul-Haq condemned the U.S. for its support of Israel, drawing parallels between the U.S. bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki and the current Israeli bombardment of Gaza. He also announced plans for a protest march to the U.S. Embassy, slated for the last Friday of Ramadan, criticizing the silence of Muslim rulers and praising global citizens who stood with Palestinians.
Karachi's Call for Action Advertisment In Karachi, the commercial heart of Pakistan, thousands marched along M.A. Jinnah Road, voicing their demands for a cease-fire and the establishment of a humanitarian corridor for Gaza. JI Karachi chief Hafiz Naeem-ur-Rehman led the rally, questioning the absence of support from Palestine's allies and lamenting the provision of weapons and aid to Israel by the U.S., UK, and their allies. The demonstrators' slogans, " Aqsa we are here ," "Gaza we are here," and "Stop genocide in Gaza," echoed throughout the city, signaling a strong collective demand for immediate peace and support for the besieged enclave.
Humanitarian Crisis Deepens The Israeli offensive has resulted in the death of over 31,000 Palestinians and injured more than 72,600, leading to widespread destruction and a dire shortage of necessities. A crippling blockade imposed by Israel has pushed the majority of Gaza's population, especially those in the north, towards starvation. According to the UN, 85% of Gaza's population is now internally displaced, facing acute shortages of food, clean water, and medicine, with 60% of the enclave's infrastructure damaged or destroyed. Amidst these escalating tensions, Israel faces accusations of genocide at the International Court of Justice, with an interim ruling demanding Tel Aviv cease its genocidal acts and ensure humanitarian assistance is provided to civilians in Gaza.
As the international community watches closely, the rallies in Pakistan serve as a poignant reminder of the global solidarity with the Palestinian cause and the widespread call for an immediate end to the violence. These demonstrations not only showcase the deep-rooted support for Palestinians but also highlight the growing international pressure on Israel to halt its military actions and engage in meaningful peace negotiations. With the situation in Gaza deteriorating rapidly, the world awaits decisive action to prevent further loss of innocent lives and to pave the way for a lasting resolution to the conflict.

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: Empresas de recursos humanos apoyan ampliar el permiso por paternidad en México
text:
Ciudad de México, 18 abr (EFE).- La Asociación Mexicana de Empresas de Capital Humano (AMECH) apoyó este jueves la ampliación del permiso por paternidad remunerado en México, un elemento importante para el "impulso del desarrollo profesional de las mujeres" y de una sociedad "más igualitaria".
En un comunicado, la organización respaldó que estas licencias pasen de los cinco días actuales a los 20, una medida que la Cámara de Diputados aprobó el pasado diciembre como una reforma de la Ley del Trabajo.
"Representa un avance significativo en materia de derechos laborales y equidad de género. Mejora la retención de talento en empresas al demostrar compromiso con la conciliación laboral", destacó.
Aseguró que permite a las mujeres "contar con un mayor apoyo durante los primeros días de crianza" e "impacta positivamente en lo laboral y económico".
En opinión de la AMECH, el crecimiento de la participación femenina entre 2005 y 2023, que aumentó cinco puntos porcentuales, "ha sido mínimo".
Según la Encuesta Nacional de Ocupación y Empleo, el 76,1 % de los hombres estaban en el mercado laboral en el tercer trimestre de 2023 frente al 46,4 % de las mujeres.
Sin embargo, el presidente mexicano, Andrés Manuel López Obrador, pidió a mediados de marzo aplazar hasta después de las elecciones del 2 de junio distintas discusiones en el Congreso de la Unión, también la que aprobaría de manera definitiva este aumento.
Actualmente, la reforma se encuentra entre los temas pendientes en el Senado.
De hecho, la organización reconoció la "controversia" que ha sobrevolado esta ampliación, concretamente por las reticencias expresadas por organismos públicos como el Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social o la Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público (SHCP), que pidieron reducir la propuesta a 10 días.
La falta de definición de López Obrador sobre estos temas ha generado polémica, en especial porque ha respaldado otras iniciativas laborales, como el aumento del salario mínimo, reformas al sistema de pensiones y la eliminación del “outsourcing” o subcontratación.
"La ampliación del permiso por paternidad emerge como una necesidad urgente", advirtió la AMECH, que apremió al Estado y al empresariado a "reconocer este derecho y a colaborar para su efectiva implementación". EFE
esr/afs/nvm

author: Жукова Диана
title: В Забайкалье отменили режим ЧС из-за лесных пожаров
text:
В Забайкалье отменили режим ЧС из-за лесных пожаров
Федеральный режим чрезвычайной ситуации, введенный в Забайкальском крае 14 апреля из-за лесных пожаров, был отменен. Об этом сообщили в Рослесхозе.
Нам важно ваше мнение!

author: Tribune News Service
title: Gang threatens liquor contractor, demands Rs 50L ransom - The Tribune
text:
Gang threatens liquor contractor, demands Rs 50L ransom
A gang has reportedly demanded a ransom of Rs 50 lakh from a liquor contractor in Yamunanagar district. It has also threatened the contractor with dire consequences if he failed to fulfil the demand.
On the complaint of the contractor, Rinku Rana of Golni village of the district, a case has been registered against the gang members at Chhappar police station.
The complainant told the police that he had been working as a liquor contractor in the district for the past four-five years.
He alleged that gangster Virender Pratap, alias Kala Rana of Yamunanagar, had demanded a ransom of Rs 20 lakh from him in lieu of running liquor vends about three years ago, but he had refused to pay the amount.
Kala Rana's brother Surya Pratap, alias Noni Rana, and Sunny, active members of the gang, had fled abroad illegally and were operating the gang from there, he said.
“On April 6, 2025, I received two WhatsApp calls on my phone at 10.35 pm from a foreign number, which I did not pick up. After that, I received five consecutive messages, threatening to kill me and my family if I did not pick up the phone,” he told the police.
At 10.52 pm, he received a WhatsApp call from the same number, which he picked up. “The caller identified himself as Noni Rana and said, 'You have escaped twice before. You have neither contributed your share in liquor contracts nor have you paid the money we demanded. Your three companions have already been killed. Now, it is your turn and that of your family. If you want to be safe, give Rs 50 lakh to Tarun Singari and Manish Singari within three days',” the complainant told the police.
He further said, “The caller also told me that if I told anyone, there would be consequences.”
Shots were fired at Rinku Rana's liquor vend in Harnaul village of Yamunanagar district on Tuesday. The vend was closed and seven-eight bullets hit the shutter. Rajesh Kumar, incharge of police post, Khera Lakkha Singh village, said the incident took place around 11.30 pm.

author: @Masrawy
title: الفيزياء كسرتنا نفسيًا.. دموع وانهيار بين طلاب الثانوية بالمنوفية | مصراوى
text:
المنوفية – أحمد الباهي:
سادت حالة من الحزن والاستياء بين طلاب الثانوية العامة بمحافظة المنوفية، اليوم الأربعاء، عقب أداء امتحان مادة الفيزياء، حيث أكد عدد كبير منهم أن الأسئلة جاءت صعبة وغير مباشرة، وتطلبت وقتًا طويلًا للتفكير والإجابة.
ورصدت عدسة الكاميرا مشاهد مؤثرة لطالبات يجهشن بالبكاء أمام لجنة مدرسة الطيار محمد شبل الثانوية بمدينة الباجور، واصفين الامتحان بأنه "كسرهم نفسيًا"، بسبب طابعه النظري المعقد وطول الأسئلة.
في المقابل، أشار طلاب الشعبة الأدبية إلى أن امتحان مادة التاريخ جاء في مستوى الطالب المتوسط، لكنه احتاج إلى وقت أطول مما هو مخصص للإجابة، خاصة مع كثرة الأسئلة وتنوعها.
وقالت إحدى الطالبات: "مش عارفة أقول سهل ولا صعب، المهم خلصنا الفيزياء والتاريخ، ونركّز في اللي جاي".
ويُذكر أن طلاب الثانوية العامة أدوا اليوم امتحاني الفيزياء والتاريخ ضمن رابع أيام ماراثون الثانوية العامة 2025، حيث يبلغ عدد الطلاب على مستوى محافظة المنوفية نحو 39,851 طالبًا وطالبة موزعين على 108 لجنة امتحانية بمختلف الإدارات التعليمية.
لمعرفة حالة الطقس الآن اضغط هنا
لمعرفة أسعار العملات لحظة بلحظة اضغط هنا

author: @wion
title: Easter 2024: Date, Celebrations and Rituals – Here's All You Need to Know
text: Mar 29, 2024, 08:39 PM IST Easter 2024 falls on 31st March. It celebrates Jesus Christ's resurrection from the dead, as described in the New Testament of the Bible. It is the most important event in Christianity, symbolising the victory of life over death and the promise of salvation. Easter is celebrated worldwide with various traditions. Many people attend church services, participate in feasts, and engage in Easter egg hunts and other activities symbolising new life and rebirth. Easter eggs and the Easter Bunny are common symbols associated with the holiday, representing new life and fertility. The Easter egg hunt is a popular activity for children, while adults often exchange Easter eggs as gifts. For Christians, Easter commemorates the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead, a pivotal event in Christian theology symbolising hope and redemption. Different cultures have unique ways of celebrating Easter. In some regions, there are processions, reenactments of the Passion of Christ and other religious and cultural events. Easter is a time for families and communities to come together. It is often marked by shared meals and gatherings, reinforcing bonds and traditions.
